pli-tv-bu-vb-sk33:1.13: Uttaribhaṅga. According to Vin-vn-ṭ.1907 this is just another word for byañjana: uttaribhaṅgaṁ nāma byañjanaṁ. Byañjana seems to refer to curries apart from the standard bean-curries, which are called sūpa. However, since uttaribhaṅga is a rare word, the basic meaning of which is something like “further condiments”, it is quite possible that it is here meant to include all foods apart from bean-curries.
